subject: Nutrition
title: Sugar and the Brain
description: A quick, practical guide to Sugar and the Brain.

hook.text: Rats given unlimited sugar develop binging, withdrawal, and toleranceâ€”the three hallmarks of addiction.

buildup.text: Sugar activates the brain's opioid receptors, producing mild euphoria similar to morphine at lower intensity.

discovery.text: MRI scans show sugar lights up the same reward circuits as cocaine, though much less intensely.

twist.text: The sugar industry spent decades calling addiction research 'junk science' and 'fear mongering.'

climax.text: Whether sugar is truly addictive remains debated, but its power over reward circuits is well documented.

punchline.text: Sugar may not be addictive, but your brain can't tell.

quiz.question: What three addiction hallmarks do rats show with unlimited sugar?
